portal_hypertension.title: Diagnostic performance of splenic stiffness measurement for prediction of esophageal/gastric varices in pediatric portal hypertension: A systematic review and meta-analysis.
portal_hypertension.journal: Indian journal of gastroenterology : official journal of the Indian Society of Gastroenterology
portal_hypertension.authors: Panda K, Dash DP, Pattnaik B
portal_hypertension.zhSummary: 该文聚焦门静脉高压症，属于综述研究。核心观点：食管/胃静脉曲张（EV），尤其是临床上显着的静脉曲张（CSV），是小儿门脉高压（PH）危及生命的并发症，需要及时检测。 临床提示：虽然食管胃十二指肠镜检查 (EGD) 仍然是黄金标准，但其侵入性和对儿童镇静的要求突出表明需要可靠的非侵入性替代方案来进行筛查和风险分层。
portal_hypertension.abstract: Esophageal/gastric varices (EV), especially clinically significant varices (CSV), represent life-threatening complications of pediatric portal hypertension (PH), necessitating timely detection. While esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) remains the gold standard, its invasive nature and requirement for sedation in children highlight the need for reliable non-invasive alternatives for screening and risk stratification. Splenic stiffness measurement (SSM) has emerged as a potential tool. This systematic review and meta-analysis aimed to evaluate diagnostic accuracy of SSM for detecting EV and CSV in pediatric PH. A comprehensive search of PubMed, Scopus and Embase was performed up to January 2025....

portal_hypertension.title: Transvenous Extrahepatic Portosystemic Shunts (TEPS): Intravascular Ultrasound-Guided Creation of Portocaval, Mesocaval, and Splenorenal Shunts.
portal_hypertension.journal: Journal of vascular and interventional radiology : JVIR
portal_hypertension.authors: Gupta AN, Louie JD, Sze DY
portal_hypertension.zhSummary: 该文聚焦门静脉高压症，属于临床研究（样本量约为 13）。核心观点：评估血管内超声（IVUS）引导下经静脉肝外门体分流术（TEPS）对不适合经颈静脉肝内门体分流术（TIPS）建立的患者的可行性以及长期安全性和有效性。 临床提示：一项单中心回顾性研究对 23 名患者（19 名成人，4 名儿童；中位年龄 55.7 岁，范围 8-75 岁；男性 N=13，57%）进行了一项单中心回顾性研究，这些患者因静脉曲张出血（N=20，83%）、难治性静脉曲张出血而接受了 24 次 TEPS 治疗。
portal_hypertension.abstract: To evaluate the feasibility and long-term safety and effectiveness of intravascular ultrasound (IVUS)-guided transvenous extrahepatic portosystemic shunt (TEPS) creation for patients unsuitable for transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt (TIPS) creation. A single-center, retrospective study was performed in 23 patients (19 adult, 4 pediatric; median 55.7 years, range 8-75 years; male N=13, 57%) who underwent 24 TEPS creations for variceal bleeding (N=20, 83%), refractory ascites (N=3, 13%), or pre-operative portal decompression (N=1, 4%).
